values:
If you are coming here to see some of my artwork, well, I don't update here anymore. You can check my Deviant art page at 
http://yooki42.deviantart.com 

or my website (which will soon be updated, I promise!) at
http://www.aorange.com/yooki/comicsforkids.html 

or my blog at 
http://yooki42.blogspot.com

Cool, thanks.

Here's a girl walking along This is just a thumbnail. Click on it to see the whole thing and 6 different colored versions! Also a friend of mine from the QT: Mostly I just post in my blog now at http://yooki42.blogspot.com so you should check that out.

It's okay, I guess I think Bowser's the best part. I just don't think this really compares with all the ones my friends have done over the years. Also, because I just realized I hadn't posted any here, one of my comics I submitted to the school paper: The rest are at http://yooki42.deviantart.com I'm working on a few more LJ comics and trying to learn Flash from a book. Hopefully each will prove fruitfull in their...efforts? Labors? I don't know how that goes.

Today was the first day of work! I've ended up aquiring a bunch of new caricatures from my friends over the past few days, so I scanned some of my favorites. Me like Pablo Picasso by Matt Raney This one is actually a year old, but I still stand by the fact that this is the best caricature I've ever had drawn. It breaks every single caricature drawing rule, then makes up some rules and breaks those, but it still manages to look exactly like me. Of my many caricatures, this is the only one I actually keep hung up. - John, Javier, and Me as the cast of The Little Mermaid by Lauren Hale After 4 years of drawing it on other people I finally managed to get myself drawn like a mermaid. I feel so pretty. I especially like how different she was able to make John and I look (we are twins). The rest of these are in a handy dandy - Me in Escape from New York by Javier Gonzales This is the best body I've ever had drawn on a caricature. Look at that shit. I told him to draw me in some kind of action/b-movie type of setting, so he drew me surfing with a machine gun on a tidal wave out of a giant whole through New York with a pimp in a convertable flipping me off on the side of the road. Awesome. - Me in less than 2 minutes by Javier Gonzales As a practice excercise we all had to draw a kid playing videogames in under 2 minutes. Javier, of course, drew me. This looks great, especially considering he wasn't even looking. - Me hugging Max by Lauren Hale Lauren didn't like this one because she messed up on my hand, but I like it anyway. That's a great picture of Max. Also, she threw in some acne at no extra charge. - Me drawing by Matt Raney I wasn't there when Raney drew this but I found it in the pile of practice caricatures. I think he added on about 120 pounds here for whatever reason, but I really like his use of lines in the face. This is seriously one of the best jobs ever. It doesn't even feel like work. They're adding a bunch of new things to the park this year too, so I'm pretty excited. Maybe one day I'll post a caricatures I've drawn. MAYBE.

As research for his comic we've been asking anyone who visits the apartment what social class they would "do" if they could go back to any time in the world. Raney still holds by flappers. What would you guys choose?

A lot of great stuff happened today, but I think I'll spread it out over a few diferent comics. I cannot for the life of me find my good inking pen. The lines were really shakey on this because I was using some off-brand brush pen. WHERE ARE YOU FABRE CASTEL???? My goal hear with this color scheme is to blind as many people as possible before they get to the end of the comic. From left to right here is Lauren, Jessica, Rachel, and Marrissa. Both the cats, John, and Raney were in there too but not until later.

has been drawing comics in his live journal which really inspired me. I mean, I've heard of these "live Journal comics" before, but now I'm really ready and rearin' to go! My first forray is a little simplistic, but more shall follow! I may go to another journal for these. We'll see. More complex inking and coloring will appear in the future, but for now I just want to get a ballpark range for how long these will take and if I can really try and do lettering without a computer.

Nothing is more hillarious than when you get all your roomates together to pay the rent and one guy is like, "Oh shit, I have $0" and so you all gotta cover for him! Especially when he resigned the 9 month lease with you NOT EVEN A WEEK AGO. What a roomate! This is a word-for-word mock phone conversation I had with Raney when we were talking about money and all the wonderful things you can't do without it. I realized when I drew this it was pretty much A Jon Arbuckle talking on the phone gag, so I threw Garfield in there. JR hasn't paid the rent on time in three months. The last two times he was close and he paid us back soon, but this time he's lost his job and has no prospects. He kept telling us all month he still had some money for rent! Why would he wait 'till the last minute???? Who DOES that? I'm pretty sure we're giving him the boot. Seriously though, other than that, life is going good. Been drawin'. Good classes this semester. Cleaned.

Well, since I am obviously the biggest super hero fan in the universe: I seriously thought my ISP was going to revoke my license to the internet I didn't do something about this It was fun to mess around with in Photoshop, I tried some things I don't do very often, but nothing real impressive. I still feel like I'm grounding myself a bit too much when it comes to CG. I'm trying out the not-weighting-the-lines thing. Gonna dip my toe in the water to see how it feels. So far I'm a little ready to get out of the pool, but I'l give it another try. One of my favorites is this one which is what inspired me to do mine :).

I've been sleeping in the same bed as John for the past three days now. It is experiences like this that I have as a twin which I think will help me better approach a marriage relationship than most "single siblings" might.
However, I doubt my future wife will be waking me up in the we hours of the morning because she had her Nintendo DS turned up too loud.

Its been a blast here though. Anyone who doesn't know the domino game "42" should learn it, and anyone who hasn't played Castlevania Dawn of Sorrows for the DS should play it.


I miss Max.

New Years was a blast. It made a Super Sonic Man Out Of Me. I was the designated driver this New Years, so I had THE MOST FUN OF ALL. Hear I am reading the Silmarillion. I found it in Rachel's roomate's room. Do I know how to party, OR WHAT? So many fisticuffs were had, I can't even count them all. (John on the right, not me) Ranry, John, and JR singing the Party Theme. DON'T STOP ME NOW, CAUSE I'M HAVING A GOOD TIME, HAVING A GOOD TIME This is Raney and his GF Rachel who let us have the party at her house. She was really cool about it, considering one of our roomates through up on her floor. This is JR attacking. He is the aforementioned roomate that through up on the floor.It was EVERYWHERE. I've never seen anyonr throw up from getting drunk before. LOL I didn't know these people but they were cool. They stopped making out to give me my phone when they found that I'd lost it in the bed they were making out on. AWESOME. Hunter hitting on Raney These two girls are HOT. I cannot TOUCH THEM. Because they are so HOT. Robyn wa my designated not-drinking buddy. Obviously the party just wasn't kicking enough for the dry members of the team, so we both fell asleep about ten minutes in. Not pictured: The New Years after perty. John, Raney, and I all woke up at five in the morning for no reason, talked awhile, then ran to the QT and all got some coffee / eats, and came back to the apartment where we opened all the windows and watched the KISS meets the PHANTOM OF THE PARK movie. It was the cheeziest movie ever, and a great way to spend the we hours of the night. We also saw some old Swamp Thing and Visionaries cartoons which really floated our boats. We don't know how to party without cartoons or B-Movies.

Our apartment has been taken over by the amazing Mario Kart DS. Yes, it is corny. Yes, it is cheezy. But there are few times when I've had more fun than utterly destroying my roomates at this game. My character of choice? Daisy! Why? Who knows! She makes for a nice orange color scheme though. I had a lot of trouble finding a screenshot from Mario Kart DS that would work for this, and once I finally did I had to edit Peach out of it. The fish is a bit distracting too, but I had to take what I could get. That thing on the hood of her car is pixel per pixel my avatar in that game. My name is Clarence, and my friend code is 352246820456 if anyone wants to race.

I saw The Lion, The Witch, and The Wardrobe. It was good, I guess, but it wasn't Lord of the Rings. I really wanted it to be Lord of the Rings. It looks like King Kong by Mr. Lord of the Rings Peter Jackson is going to be more Lord of the Rings. Oh well. It was worth my 8 bucks, anyway.

Tomorrow I hope to draw something. And then I hope to post it on the internet, because drawing things and posting them on the internet is what makes me an artist.

Professor Tosten said my comic was "brilliant". That's a new one from a professor!

So I couldn't register for classes until today. Yesterday, however, EVERY SINGLE CLASS I WAS SCHEDULED TO REGISTER FOT FILLED UP.
A week ago I got advised and all my advisors said my schedule was good to go. I've been planning my degree out so it isn't really alter-able. What was the point of messing with all the beuracracy of the advising process and the nonsense of collecting signatures when in the end they just hide behind that SAME buracraucy, try to pass the buck to someone else, and there's no accountability?
Why are there only 18 seats available in almost every required class for a grapic desing major? Can there only BE 18 graphic desin majors at UTA? Why am I not one?
WHY AM I GOING TO UTA?

Anyway, I've fenangled my schedule enough to where I can take the mimium required hours to still keep my grant and none of the courses are TOTALLY off my degree plan, but they certainly aren't pushing it forward anywhere...
Still a relief though, I guess.

My friend Raney proposed he and I draw a 7 page comic in 7 days, and so it was done. We had to create new characters and a new plot and everything. He didn't finish his in time, but here's the first page to whet your appetite. The rest are present in a lj cut: I have some things I like about it, some things I'm not too fond of. A more advanced critique can be found at http://www.deviantart.com/view/24943405/ Mostly I just think it all looks rushed. Go figure :). Some of my influences on the character designs were Dave Kelly, Josh Leznik, and David McGuire. I want to draw more comics more often!

So what if I started on online comic again?
I'm working on this "7 pages in 7 days" comic project with som eof my friends and I'm having a lot of fun. Looking through my lj friends has reminded me of a lot of good times with that crowd too.
Hmmm...

I've decided to start posting in this thing some more.
Post if you still read these so I can get an idea of my audience. Thanks :)

Today I went out to find some NES games and it appears that they don't sell 'em at most places anymore. Ever since we moved out to Arlington I haven't been able to find any good spots to collect.
So eventually we ended up at an old giant thrift store. They didn't have any NES games but they had a TON of amazingly old computer games for only a buck fitty each. We picked up:

Kings Quest 2
Kings Quest 3
Kings Quest 4
Space Quest 1
Space Quest 2
Elvira Mistress of the Dark
Elvira 2 The Jaws of Cerberus
Conan the Cimmerian
The Immortal
Conquest of Camelot
Orbitus
Future Wars

As it turns out The Immortal and Orbitus only came with their 5 1/4th floppys. You know, the B:/ ones. Unfortunately there was no way to figure that out in the store. We're going to e-mail the companies and see if we can trade them out for 3 1/2" ones (some places still offer that).

Anyway, as it turns out these things took FOREVER to install. I had to install a MSDOS emulator since Windows 9x is not DOS based. The emulator doesn't make much since, but I've gotten it tied down. It looks like I ruined the files on the Elvira disk though. We'll see.
All in all it was a fun-filled afternoon for only around $18.50. But since everything came full in their boxes and instructions I've got to find a place to put all this crap.


Lastly, anyone who hasn't heard from me since I last posted here, please check out my deviant gallery at http://yooki42.deviantart.com/ as I've done a lot of neat stuff lately.

Everyone go check out my deviant art gallery.
All updates and life-altering events will now be recorded there.

http://yooki42.deviantart.com/

Someday I might actually update one of my websites, or this LJ thing, but no time soon.
Have fun.

Okay, so I have registered with an account at photobucket, so I might start posting pictures here again. Anyway, i need to post here more often! About stuff! So I can look back and remember things! Oh well, here's what I did today. I made dolls at http://elouai.com/doll-makers/candybar-doll-maker.php ! Here's the one Amy did of herself: So I did one of MYself, but the thing has no guy template. (That's max in the background). And then I did ones of Lauren and Jessica (Whom I FINALLY got around to adding to my friends list). And then I ran out of girls I know so I did one of Matt Raney's character, Bounty Hunter Jones. Well,that was eventful.

All the images in my LJ were deleted. I lost all my space on my charter account. Now, whenerver I want to link to an image I will link to it in my deviant gallery :(
Well, maybe I'll post it in my Livejournal, but on subsequent updates I'll post a link to my deviant gallery.
Anyway, I intend to use this thing for actual posting now. Intend. We'll see.
I updated http://webpages.charter.net/skidrow/
This checks one thing off th elong list of things I need to clean up around here.

Booster and Valentina were some of the best Mario extras EVER. I've been playing Paper Mario 2 lately. I have almost beat it. I like it a heck of a lot more than Paper Mario 1, and only a little less than Superstar Saga (which I LOVED). So, here's the final standing from best to not-so-best: 1. Super Mario RPG - One of the greatest games ever. One of the funniest games I've ever played, with an excelent replay value. There isn't a single NPC in this game that is not a riot to talk too. Good music too. I liked how epic this one seemed too. 2. SuperStar Saga - Mario and Luigi together. Funny, creative, and plenty of great extra characters. Very fun, and it pulled no syops in having a great ending and boss battles. 3. Paper Mario 2 - Not far behind Superstar Saga. There are some fundamental problems with the way the cast members are used, but each cast member (aside from Maam Flurrie) is awesome. A good number of the extras are fun too (like Rawk Hawk and Dupliss), but some (like Flavio and the Detective Guy) are unberrible. Some parts of this game can seem like work, but overall this is a very fresh, fun game. I love Bobbery and Ms Mous. We need more characters like these. 135. Paper Mario - I really don't like this game too much. The Peach parts we fun, but nearly all your partners are borring (aside from Bow) and most of this game seems like work (the ShyGuy Toolbox, the desert, the Lakiluster's dang flower level...). Most of the extras were borring, and after I'd beat it, there were absolutley no secrets I hadn't uncovered, and no reason to replay.

This is a picture I did of my friend Lauren. She likes dinosaurs. Or she did, at one time. When I knew here years ago. The likeness isn't perfect, but I think it works. I tried to get your little smirk in there, Lauren. Okay, I know you don't have purple hair or eyes. I can easily change that piece of hair to black and your eyes brown if you so wish, just say the word. From an arts-y point of view, I thought the purple went with the background. So, anyway, yeah. I hope you like it. I am pretty proud of it. Happy Birthday

I'm learning how to use the pen-tool This is so much fun! I also did this as a practice: This just in; I am the coolest person in the world. I haven't felt this proud of my artwork in a long time. I'm going to try and utilize this pen-tool for everything I can now. Woopie!
These Bosses are so boss! Click on the images to make them larger. What do you guys think? Which is your favorite? I call Bubble man. Or Quickman. Heck, I love them all!!!! (Aside from Woodman)

The Incredibles > Finding Nemo
I am tired of every single review of this movie on the face of this earth starting out with "Okay, well, so it wasn't as good as Finding Nemo, but..."
SERIOUSLY. Every second of this film was an artistic masterpiece. And it was funnier on way more levels than Finding Nemo. And had more twists and curves in the plot. And the musice was cooler. The whole MOVIE was just plain cooler. And the mom was hot.
Hey, let's hear it for Pixar pulling off a 3-D movie that stars human cartoon characters.
It felt like to me that this was a 3-D animated version of a 2-D cartoon, rather than a 3-D animated version of reality (which is the feeling Shrek gives me, and I've always found it a little dishartening).
I like The Incredibles because it wasn't just a comedy. It was and ACTION comedy, and I feel can compete with the top action movies out there. My bawls were rawked the whole way through.

Mega Man 2 > You Src pic = http://sprites.planet-megaman.com/sprites/image.php?sprite=classic/mm2/enemies I have heard comments that this would make a great button. But who would wear it? I drew, inked, and colored this all in one day. I am proud of myself. I wish I could do comics that fast. More Mega Man 2 stuff to come.

This is a chalk drawing I did on the wall of Picard Hall at UTA. After I got the idea and printed up the refrence picture Matt Raney and I got together and did this early in the morning. It took us about an hour and a half to two hours (neither of us happened to keep track). We devided the bricks each into square sized blocks and then used the squares as pixels to redraw the art. Although we started out in the desolate early morning, by the time we finished the campus was bustling with people and onlookers. Over the course of the next few days, we observed as people laughed and pointed at him. Everyone enjoyed it. Many took out digital cameras and got their picture taken next to him. I just did this for fun, but it ended up cheering up a lot of people. I guess this is my community service for the month then =) A Closer Picture of Luigi - As you can see, he is a little wide. This is because of the brick's shape. Whenever you are walking to or away from him though he evens out. Detail Closeups - Guess what parts of the picture I zoomed in on! YOu can see here how we devided the bricks up to account for the cement divisions. The Article in the School Paper - Well, not really an article, but it got some notice. I thought this was great! (Note, this is Luigi only because we didn't have any red chalk. We only had pinks, and refused to draw a pink Mario!)

I finally got around to coloring some! Now we've got Mel de Alkirk (governor of Meribia!) from Lunar, Virgil from Mighty Max, Queen Valanice of Davantry from Kings Quest (design specifically from KQ7), Ed Bighead from Rocko's Modern Life, and PQ from Knights of Ramune. Look out for Mel. He'll pound you in your pooter 'till your butt bleads. Virgil has always been one of my all time favorite know it all charcters. I like Queen Valanice because she fills the very small "old aged, rich but humerous woman" demographic in videogames. PQ, though very annoying, is just too crazy for me to pass up.
Cause if you feed me Seymore, I can grow up big and strong. The drawing is actually about a year old, but I pulled it out of retirement and colored it just for fun. I like the background myself.

John and Javier and Matt and I all saw the Brodway production of Little SHop of Horrors here in Dallas It was great fun. The show was a little different than the actual Brodway one, but no worse. I did a major update at my deviant art gallery at http://yooki42.deviantart.com I may be doing more later.

For those of you that don't know, Becky and I have seperated. We were in a long relationship, and I loved her through all of it, and still love her now, but I am weak and could no longer cope with her leaving to New York and coming back and leaving again. I think the relationship had also become a stronger responsibility than it was anything else. But I guess it had to be under the circumstances. I kept waiting for things to get better, but they never did. I don't know if they ever would have. Maybe. The security was nice though. I really had planned to marry her. I've kind of torn my future to pieces now, and don't know which way is up. I'll find it though. It has also come to pass that I am now dating Jessica Hale, a friend of mine from work. She draws really cute caricatures, and she is a very happy person. We are alike, both very clumsy and pretty dumb. I like her a whole whole lot, but I'm having trouble being the dominant person in our relationship. I hve trouble being the dominant person in any situation. I feel like I've done some things wrong with Jessica, and that our pacing has been entirely off. But we'll bang out the kinks, I think. Here's a picture of here as drawn by Amy: Pretty darn accurate, actually. Would you expect any less from Amy? Here are some pictures Jessica drew of me and her: Cute, isn't it? I told you so. And just to clear things up, I didn't break up with Becky to go out with Jessica. Jessica was sort of a catalyst, but the day I knew our relationship had to go on hold was when she told me she was going back to New York again even though she was not going to attend NYU. That had destroyed my heart and I knew I wan't going to be able to take that anymore. I'm sorry I'm weak. And I'm sorry you all had to listen to this mush. I'm usually the one that doesn't make these kinds of posts, but what can I say?

All of these come with their covers too!
SOrry I was too late for the contest Robbie, but you know, I'm sure you're used to me being too late for everything. I s'pose this is just fanart for fanart's sake then. Hope you enjoy =)
Mebbe later there will be a post with actual content. Mebbe.

Hey guys, sorry I haven't posted in a while. I went to Germany and my scanner broke. Then work scheduled me 25 hours a day, 8 days a week; and whenever I come home my dad beats me until I am dead. Anyway, we bought a new scanner. And since we did, I decided to scan in a bunch of the stuff I've been drawing at work lately since Daniel showed some intrest. Before you check this out Daniel, there's a few things you should know (I don't know what you know and what you don't, so I'll just go over it all): Here's all the artists that currently work for us: Javier Gonzales (who is now a manager), Lauren Hale (who's sort of built like Javier, they have taken a liking to eachother), Me, John, Matt Raney (He's Back), Amy Goreman (John's ex-girlfriend who recently became his girlfriend again after working with us for a while), Jason Robbins (One of Chance's friends), Chance McGee (We now cal him "Gator", after Gator McGee's resteraunt; he has also formede a habit of always being over 30 minutes late to any shift; also, he sports a fro now), and lastly, Tim Duran (the same old, awesome Tim). There are a series of images here where we drew members of Big Time as foods. This was due to a truly horrid 2nd grade drawinf someone (nobody knows who, it was proably a tattoo guy) posted of Jason as a Donut, which created an entire spin-off of other members as foods. Yeah, well, here's the directory: http://webpages.charter.net/skidrow/work/ http://webpages.charter.net/skidrow/work/Michael/workmario.jpg is probably my favorite. Try to figure out who everyone is and post it in my comment section. I'll let you know who you got right =)

This time we've got Spitz from Wario Ware, Dexter's Dad from Dexter's Laboratory, Booster from Mario RPG, the Chancellor from Mario RPG, and the Ardvark from the Ant and the Ardvark cartoons. Anyway, I'm out. The Chancellor rules.

All Cats this time! Purrr-fect! This time we've got Puar from DBZ, Artemis from Sailor Moon, MadCat from Inspector Gadget, Ura from El-Hazard, and Evil T Cat from Earthworm Jim! God, I love Artemis, he has a great voixce actor and was always funny. I think I will redraw MadCat as he has some left to be desired. Remember that comics 42 website? I don't either.

Jut like Robbie I am going to start releasing sets of five icons portraying characters from some of my favorite videogames/cartoons. Let the fun begin! To start I've got: Lolo from The Adventures of Lolo; The Lobe from Freakazoid; Fred from Samurai Pizza Cats; Zen-Chan from Bubble Bobble; and Jay Sherman from The Critic. Many, many, many more to come! Hope you enjoy.

Okay, so I caved. I got an account at http://yooki42.deviantart.com/

I am now emmensely interested as to who else has one of these. Any of my friends that has one comment here and give me your name! Weeeee.

OMG, I've just been up for like an hour trading crappy computer art with Amy! Here are some of the better ones we did After her gemins one I did a few of her like this one: Then I told her to draw a spider crab. She of course made this crotch-related. I liked how that one was full body so I did a large one as well: Which lead to this one by her. Don't worry. It is equally as crotch related as her last. Man, I gotta stay up late drawing more often!
Amy drew me with those 80's glasses that light up and flash!!! Ha ha ha ha!!! I actually found a place that sells them for 10 dollars. I'll probably buy a pair.
THis is also edited from that pic Robbie had. This one took like 3 hours 0_o. I don't know what my problem was. It was fun though. Death is also awesome.
I lifted this fromt hat picture Robbie posted and cleaned it up and made it awesome. Because Judgement is awesome.

Wanna see my super hot summertime swimsuit pinup? Well, you asked for it: I think it is unbalanced to the right a little. A friend also pointed out that the outline around him could have been bolder too. Damn it, he's right. I still really like the style though, and how cartoony I managed to make him look. It was so much more fun.

Yaaay! Frontpage Editor is working!
I know, I know, I really need to stop using it as a crutch, but, well, it just makes things so much QUICKER for me. I am going to take a class in Dreameaver soon, I promise.

Anyway, I just uploaded some stuff to the totally NEW domain; http://www.comics42.com just to prove I could do it. And I can. I proved it. There's really nothing there at all (not even a little bit) but there will be come tomorrow or the next day!

Also, I am going to update that old art site of mine tomorrow or the next day. I already spruced up the ol' profile page here: http://vet.keenspace.com/hhhqabout.htm . The previous one was over a year old so it didn't have anything about Becky. I like the new image on there a lot more. I will also have an entire main page revamp soon! I'll keep you posted (I know you're on the edge of your seats OMG!!!)

If you call me...

"Michael" - You are one of my IRL friends that aren't named Matt or a relative.

"Mike" - You are either Mett O'kelly or Matt Raney. They are about thae only ones who do that, but it doesn't bother me.

"John" - You are almost anyone about 50 percent of the time.

"Henderson" - You know both John and I and you have given up trying to distinguish. (Not that I mind this either)

"The Twins" - You are most of my casual aquaintences from high school.

"Cash" - You are one of the guys at work. (John and I are known as "Tango and Cash" up there)

"Honey" - You are Becky. And I love you.

"Otakuohki" - You know of me either from my livejournal or my time in the Funny Farm Forum.  I have tried to cycle this one out as much as possible, mostly bceause it sounds like a 12 year old's alias.

"Yooki42" or "Yooki" - You know me from almost every other forum I post in (Mostly art critque forums, a few blogs, and Go Gaia)

"Ernie T Catgirl" - You have talked to me on Instant Messenger a lot. And you probably think I am a girl. Who likes cats.

"The Animator" or "The Author" - You are the characters of my various comics.

"Hey...." - You don't know me but you want to get my attention for some reason.

To me!!

And, I suppose, John too. We shared birthdays today.
He got a cookie cake and I got a real one.
Ice Cream Sandwiches were had by all.
I miss my girlfriend. Art will almost certainly come of this.
